quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, sport.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I heard someone got engaged, you dog, huh? [punches Michael's shoulder]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ow! God!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, nothing can hurt you now. You're a man in love!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I was there. That dude is not engaged. I'm not a big believer in therapy, but I'll go into my own pocket to cover his co-pay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Big idea: double wedding. Me, Angela, you, Holly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, we would never do that. And if we did, it would be with Jim and Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, we'd never do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, so there you go.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [enters Michael's office] Michael, I got my bridesmaid dress.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, wow, so quickly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah, and you said I could get it in any color I wanted, so I picked white.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Michael, did you tell your mom yet?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Nope. Nope. Not yet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You wouldn't tell your mom?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You love your mom.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Call your mom, Michael. [everyone talking]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'll call her later.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.line: [chanting and clapping] Call her! Call her!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't want to do that. [chanting continues] All right. [picks up phone and dials] She is going to freak out!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [punches button] Speakerphone!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's -- thanks.

quotes.speaker: Mother
quotes.line: [on speakerphone] Hello?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mom, I'm getting married.

quotes.speaker: Mother
quotes.line: No, you're not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why do you always do that? Whenever I'm getting married, you don't believe me.

quotes.speaker: Mother
quotes.line: Well, are you getting married?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Mother
quotes.line: Are you-- [Michael ends call]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm not, I'm not getting married. So... [laughs] Psych.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: So I returned my bridesmaid dress, and it was on sale, so I'm out $100.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And I'm out a fiancee. Are those the customer surveys?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah, uh, this is all of them: Jim, Dwight, Phyllis, Stanley, Andy and -- oh. Oh, it's the receipt to my bridesmaid dress. What's that doing there? [hands stack of papers to Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'll take care of that for you. [crumples receipt and throws it in trash] Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Kelly Kapoor is our dusky, exotic customer service rep. And once a year, she will contact our clients and find out how happy they are with our salespeople. Sort of a Kapoor's List. "Schindler's List" parody. ... That's not appropriate, no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Those reports affect our bonuses, which is kind of great for me, because you wouldn't know it from looking at her, but Pam's a gold-digger.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [on Bluetooth speaker] Hey, New York ain't free. Get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Aww.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It's the world's tiniest Bluetooth. I found it in a Japanese gadget store in the village. I got one for Jim, too. Jim, say something.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [on Bluetooth] Testing, testing. Hello, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: We wanted to stay on the phone all day, but the company has a policy against eight-hour personal calls. So we're not telling anyone.

quotes.speaker: Alex
quotes.line: Uh, Pam. What do you want on your coffee?

quotes.speaker: Jim and Pam
quotes.line: Sprinkle of cinnamon.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I should go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alrighty, Dwighty, let's see how you did.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Bring it on. [starts to put foot up on Michael's desk]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What does it say?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Dwight, your feedback is horrible.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's impossible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: A number of your clients found your personal style abrasive and distasteful.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I sell more paper than anyone. [stands and reaches for the file]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wait, is this a joke? I'm getting that queasy feeling that sometimes accompanies jokes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do I look like I am joking?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, but that's sometimes part of it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: If I were joking, you would be laughing. Do you look like you are laughing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Impossible to say. I can't see myself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You're not.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yo, Tommy Tuna, did you get your scores yet?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I got mine. They were really good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [listening in New York] I miss him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You must be really proud.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, pretty psyched. Whoa! That's my mug.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, sorry. It was just -- it was right here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Right, well, it's mine, so if you could pour it out and get another one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK. Or maybe I could finish the coffee that's in here and you could use [finds a mug] uh, oh -- Snoopy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Don't give him Snoopy. That's mine.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [smiles] It is a great mug. But it's not my mug. That is my mug. So give it back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: How can you even be sure?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It has my face on it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [holds mug next to Andy's head] Make the face. [Andy smiles] Yeah, I don't see it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Dude, that is my face!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [Dwight slams something on desk] What was that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow. That was Dwight. He seems upset about something.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Describe him exactly. What color mustard is his shirt? Yellow or Dijon?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It is... more of a spicy brown, actually.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What are you mumbling about?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: How was your meeting with Michael?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: None of your business.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Was it your scores?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Those can't be my scores, Jim. For your information --

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm being sabotaged.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And I'm going to find that person and punish them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Absolutely. Or you could just be nice to your customers.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You're an idiot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: There's the charm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jimbo, let's do this thang.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That is me. Wish me luck.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No way.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [whispers on bluetooth] Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I didn't say anything

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I love you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I love you, too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What do you think I am saying to you?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm not talking to you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I've caught Jim talking to himself several times today. What a loser. Get a friend, loser.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [on phone] Yeah, I'm looking at it right now. It's really gorgeous. You guys do great work.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I found the best tentist on the east coast. He personally tented Giuliani's first and third weddings. And I got him. [shakes fist] I got him!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [on phone] Would you be able to do the same design, but with walls of gray? And a top that's gray too? Fabulous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, come on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You too?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Did my scores drop a little?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jim, they are a poopy. [Jim coughs, presses button to end call on Bluetooth]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [touches ear] Jim? Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Are we even sure that's my file?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. [glances at it] Yes, I am sure, Jim. It --

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, there's got to be an explanation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I agree.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So let's see what we can find out from reading. [reads] Jim Halpert is smudge and arrogant.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I think you mean smug

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [points at Jim] Arrogance.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Michael, I'm just trying to --

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And there's our smudgeness.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I need a decent bonus, because I'm actually in the process of buying my parents' house so that they can retire. And if history tells us anything, it's that you can't go wrong buying a house you can't afford. Pam doesn't know about the house, so it's... a fun surprise. [taps Bluetooth earpiece] Pam, sorry about that. I lost you for a second. So, as it turns out, I may not have done so hot on my customer reviews this year.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Maybe it's because you spent the whole year flirting with the receptionist.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: A little bit. ... Worth it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Here's what's going to happen. I am going to have to fix you, manage you two on a more personal scale, a more micro form of management. Jim, what is that called?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Microgement.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Boom! Yes. Now, Jim is going to be the client. Dwight, you're going to have to sell to him without being aggressive, hostile or difficult. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: All right, fine. [picks up phone] Brrring.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [picks up phone] Hello?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hello, this is Dwight Schrute from the Dunder Mifflin Paper Company.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow, that's great, because I need paper.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Excellent, then you are in luck, because we are having a limited-time offer only on everything.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow, this is my lucky day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [whispers] Ask him his name.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What is your name, sir?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I am Bill Buttlicker.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Really, that's your real name?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: How dare you? My family built this country, by the way.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Be respectful, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Would you hold on one second? That's my other line.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What? No, but I --

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hello? [laughs] No, I'm just on the phone with this stupid salesman. He's so dumb. Probably just gonna keep him on the line forever and not buy anything. Yeah, OK. [punches button on phone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's up to you to change his mind.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sorry. That was a family emergency.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, no. What's wrong?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know what? That's private.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Boundaries, Dwight. Come on!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Sorry, Mr. Buttlicker. As I was saying, we're having a limited--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sorry, you're going to have to speak up a little bit louder. I'm hard of hearing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: He's hard of -- he's an old man. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK, as I was saying, right now we are having --

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You're gonna have to talk louder.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK, our prices have never been lower.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Son, you have to talk louder.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: ...never been lower!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Louder, son!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [shouting] Buttlicker! Our prices have never been lower!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Stop it! Stop it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He --

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That is totally inappropriate. You never yell at the client. You never yell at the client.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Now, you listen to me, sir.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: The three words I would describe you as is aggressive, hostile and definitely difficult.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Give me the phone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Please, Mr. Buttlicker --

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm irate right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Give me the phone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Please give me another chance. Mr. Buttlicker.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Give me the phone. Give me the phone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I have to put you on with my boss.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, I should hope so. [Michael takes phone] Who is this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hello, this is Michael Scott, regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, this is William M. Buttlicker.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hello, Mr. Buttlicker. How may we help you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Michael, I like the sound of your voice. You know what I'm going to do? I'm going to buy one million dollars worth of paper products today.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [shakes fist, whispers] Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [covers phone, whispers to Dwight] See how it's done? [into phone] Thank you very much, sir. I don't think you'll regret it. [to Dwight] See what I did?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You are the master.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: There is one condition, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You have to fire the salesman that treated me so terribly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Don't do it, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ... [whispers] It's a million-dollar sale.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: So it's called the Shangri-La Tent. It's two stories, heated and has a bridal suite for my bridal sweet. It's just really simple, really tasteful.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I don't want to be married in a tent like a hobo

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hobos live in trains.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Nana Mimi can't be in canvas that long.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well, Nana Mim -- Ahh. OK, look. This tent is awesome. And it's in high demand, so I really think we should put a deposit down now.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: OK fine you can have your tent, but only if it's in a field, a hand-plowed field

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Done and done-er.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: There has to be a barn that's old enough that you can see the stars through the roof slats when you lay on your back. And antique tools to look at when you roll over.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Do you have a specific place in mind?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No. But anything within a five- to eight-mile radius is acceptable.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: On it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight. Dwight. [Dwight's car comes screeching into view]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Get in!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Get in! [he peels off into parking space]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK, what are you --

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Shh. [turns radio up loud, playing "Centerfold."] They might be listening to us.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: They might be listening to us

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Who's they?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Customer service might be monitoring this conversation.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: In this car?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You never know. Better safe than sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [turns radio down] What are you thinking?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Who stands to benefit from our downfall?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: The mob, maybe NASA.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Could be the mob. But then Dunder-Mifflin would need to be a front for money laundering, and there's little evidence of that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Is there some evidence?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [on Bluetooth] Ooh, cute shoes online.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: How many shoes do you need?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I don't know. Two, maybe three if one wears out. How many shoes do you need?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm not talking to you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Who are you talking to?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: She's not here, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, she's not.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [in New York, humming to herself to the tune of "Centerfold"] Na na na na na. Na na na na na na na.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [at computer, spins chair around and makes triumphant gesture] Yes!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I found it. I found the perfect place. A local bed-and-breakfast on a 60-acre beet farm. And even better, I have an in with the owner. Oh, yeah. We work together. It's Dwight Schrute. As in Schrute Farms.

quotes.speaker: Customer
quotes.line: [on phone] So I'd like to redouble my order, if  you could put me down for, um --

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wait, shut up.

quotes.speaker: Customer
quotes.line: I'm sorry?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Shh. Do you hear that?

quotes.speaker: Customer
quotes.line: Hear what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Breathing. Is that you?

quotes.speaker: Customer
quotes.line: Well, I am breathing, yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, stop. Hold your breath. I still hear it. Who's there? Kelly, is that you? Hold on. [puts down phone and runs away]

quotes.speaker: Customer
quotes.line: I need paper.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [jumps into Kelly's area] Ha! [Kelly screams in surprise]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Oh, my God. You scared me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hear anything interesting?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [laughs] I think you know.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: You always say that, and I almost never know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What are you up to, girl? Huh? Phyllis put you up to this? Stanley? Are they paying you?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Are you accusing me of something?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Of course I am. I know you're the mastermind, but you're too stupid to do it by yourself.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [behind Dwight]: OK.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [surprised] Ah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Easy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Let's just -- Let's head back to the desk.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: You just can't come into my nook and call me stupid. And maybe if you were a little bit more nice and polite, then people wouldn't give you such bad customer reviews.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The reason that I got bad customer reviews is because I didn't! There is a massive conspiracy going on here, and I know you're involved.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Dwight, get out of my nook!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [in New York] That's what she said! That's what she said! That's what she said!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Good one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [enters breakroom] Hey. Sorry about Dwight, by the way.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah, he's weird.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, we all handle it differently. I personally choose to handle it like a normal person, but...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, how are you and Darryl?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Um, we're cool. [gets up to leave] Bye.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [on Bluetooth] That was weird.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What was?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Have you ever had a conversation with Kelly where she didn't go on for 15 minutes without taking a breath?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, actually.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Did you do something to her?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, something's off.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, how's things?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Living in the moment.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Do you have any reason to believe that Kelly would be mad at me?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I don't play the politics game anymore, Jim. Can I tell you something? I played it full on in New York. I played it high stakes. For keeps. Made it to the top. But look what it cost. [takes sip of coffee] Can I tell you what else I learned?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wait, that's pretty weird.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, Andy has a mug just like that.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Oh, yeah, Kelly gave them out as party favors. Remember? You got one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No. What party?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Her America's Got Talent finale party over the summer. [Jim makes face] That's crazy. It was packed. I thought everyone was there. You were there. I remember you being there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I wasn't. But thank you. [to Pam] Do you know anything about this party?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes, I said you definitely should go, but you wanted to visit me instead.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, I can't be the only one who didn't -- [sees mugs on Angela's and Meredith's desks]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [walks quickly to break room, opens cabinet and finds mugs of Oscar, Creed and Phyllis]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight, let me see your coffee cup.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No. [holds Sheriff's Department mug protectively]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Is that it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No. Why? No. [puts it in desk drawer and slams it shut]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK, I'm gonna assume that was it. Here's the thing: I think you're right. I think it was Kelly. I think she's mad at us for not coming to her party.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, man, I knew it. Who are her co-conspirators?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Probably just Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Obviously. I knew it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's what I'm saying.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah. What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You were right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I was -- I was right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You were right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I was right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You knew it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I knew it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You knew it the whole time, buddy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I knew it the whole time, buddy! [shoves Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah! Woo-hoo!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [in New York] Right Dwight is loud.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I knew it! Yeah! Ha-ha! Woo! [kicks near Phyllis' head; she ducks] Boom! Kelly the whole time. Let's get her.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, no, no, no. Dwight, Dwight, Dwight. Let's talk about this.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why don't you tell us?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Nothing's going on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Let me paint you a picture of a little girl from southern India, who despite being welcomed into this country will now spend the rest of her life in prison for a crime she did commit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Dwight. [to Kelly] I was informed by these gentlemen that the reports that you filed may not entirely be accurate.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: What? I -- I don't know what you're talking about. This is the first I'm hearing about this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, come on. You juked the stats, cupcake.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We called about a dozen customers, and they all said that they gave us great marks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I love your tie, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [looks momentarily flattered, but thinks better of it] Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I was raped.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You cannot say "I was raped" and expect all of your problems to go away, Kelly. Not again. Don't keep doing that. I'll give you one last chance to come clean. Just tell me what happened.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: OK,  all right. OK, I did it. All right? I lied, whatever. Just fire me. But you know what? I did it because you guys didn't come to my party, and you said you would try to and then you didn't even show up, and so you're bad friends.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: We have our confession. I'm calling security. [reaches for phone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Don't. Don't. Get away from that, Dwight, please. You know what? She's got a point about you two. You do have a problem dealing with people.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: See? I wasn't lying.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You were lying.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I was lying.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes. Jim, Dwight, please excuse us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I want to be here when you fire her ass.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I will call you when it is time. [Jim and Dwight leave]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I have an enormous amount of trouble trying to get people to come to my place. And I hate it. I can't tell you how much leftover guacamole I have ended up eating over the years. I don't even know why I make it in such great quantities. Here's what we're gonna do. We are going to sit here for a while, make it look good. And maybe you should cry. Can you make yourself cry?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: No problem.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I think you should do that. [Kelly starts fake-crying, then laughing, then she and Michael both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Alex
quotes.line: Pam Beesley?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, what are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Who's that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It's Alex.

quotes.speaker: Alex
quotes.line: It's Pam. Uh, I came to kidnap you. There's free wine and cheese at the Chuck Close retrospective. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, that's gonna be great. Who's Chuck Close?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, I love Chuck Close and his photo-realist paintings. But I have to work.

quotes.speaker: Alex
quotes.line: Uh, well, actually there's something else I'd love to talk to you about. Can we go somewhere else to talk about it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's it. I want to talk to this guy. Put me in his ear.

quotes.speaker: Alex
quotes.line: [in private office] Um.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What's up?

quotes.speaker: Alex
quotes.line: I'm gonna take a big leap and I want to tell you that I think you should not move back to Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm gonna make a bigger leap here. He is into you.

quotes.speaker: Alex
quotes.line: Why did you come to New York in the first place?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Because they have a great design program, and I wanted to see if I was any good at it. And I wanted to work on my art, too.

quotes.speaker: Alex
quotes.line: Right. And that's why I think that you should stay here. Because I mean, you -- really you just got here, you know? You can't do New York in three months. You know, it has everything. It has -- all the opportunity is here. All the -- the whole art scene is in New York. You know, it would be nuts to go back to Scranton without getting to fully experience it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Jim's in Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Alex
quotes.line: I know. But all I'm saying is, if there's even a teeny, tiny part of you that really wants to be an artist, then I think you should stay here, because you don't want to wake up in 50 years and look back and wonder what could have been. And that is the end of my speech. I planned it all. Anyway ...  I will see you tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'll see you tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Alex
quotes.line: OK. [Pam and Jim look worried]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Is that the Matsuhashi B-400? The world's tiniest Bluetooth? [reaches toward Jim's ear] May I?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Don't.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Congratulations on choosing Schrute Farms for your wedding.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: We haven't decided on anything yet. We're still reviewing some options, and it's gonna come down to the numbers.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, then. Why don't you look over some of our materials? [opens album]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh. Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [looking at Angela] While I describe to you the Excalibur package. In addition to the breathtaking natural beauty and smell of Schrute Farms, I can promise you that our grounds can be catered to fit your exact specifications. [Angela smiles] I will work tirelessly for you over the coming months and be at your constant disposal. [Andy moves his head into Dwight's view] Please feel free to call or stop by, any time of the day or night.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That's very generous.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: While you, my good friend, have nothing more to worry about. This wedding is officially out of your hands.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh, thank the good Lord. Deal! [shakes Dwight's hand]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Um, what are we talking price wise?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You already said deal.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Pay him whatever he wants.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Can't argue with that. Dwight ... [takes Angela's hand] You are going to make us so happy. [Dwight and Angela grin at each other]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Come on, how did you propose? Spill it. Were you wasted?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How did I propose, let me see... well, I drove her up to Nashua, and I had the ring, a big 10-carat diamond; it was beautiful. And I got down on my hands and knees, and a shooting star crossed overhead, and it just lit up the diamond like a shooting star. And we were in a restaurant, and I put the diamond into a cheeseburger.

quotes.speaker: Kevin and Andy
quotes.line: Ooooh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And she took a bite, started to choke. So what do I do? I have CPR training. Go around, start doing the Heimlich.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: The ring, 10-carat diamond, pops out of her mouth, hits her shrimp cocktail, right onto her finger. Million-to-one shot. All of the Greek people in the restaurant start screaming "Opa!" Which means "congratulations," so...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh, man!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [in Jim's ear] Ask how he's doing since the breakup.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So, how you holdin' up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm pretty much devastated.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ask if there's anything you can do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know what you should do? Take a vacation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Maybe go to Sandals, Jamaica. Or the other Sandals, Jamaica. I just don't want to go by myself.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Tell him you'd like to go with him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We should take a look at those surveys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why are surveys important? Okay, hypothetical: A man wants to buy 500 reams of....carrots. And, so he's like "What do I do? Where do I go? Do I go to the insensitive carrot supplier, the insensitive carrot salesman? Or do I go to the nice carrot salesman, who will maybe charge a few cents more per ream of carrot, but guarantee next-day delivery on your carrots? Most companies need their carrots the next day. Now, substitute paper for carrots, and that is why surveys are important."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Great marks, Phyllis. [Phyllis walks out of Michael's office smiling]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [to Stanley] Hey, I did good too!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I knew it. Haha! [they high five]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [hand up, seeking a high five] Up! Don't leave me hangin'! [they do]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What do I do with my bonus check? [scoffs] Simple. Purchase paper from myself. Boosts my sales, which boosts my bonus. Last year I bought even more paper to make this year's bonus even bigger. Eventually, I'll get a bonus so big I can retire on it. And I'll use the paper to write my memoirs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I taught Jim and Dwight everything I know about sales. But there are certain things that cannot be taught, and it is these things that I now must teach them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Attention, all problem sales persons. Jim Halpert... Dwight Schrute...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [raises hand] Here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Intensive one-on-one retraining will begin after lunch. That is all.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I am no longer the worst salesman in the office. Yes! [Andy gestures excitedly, knocking over his coffee mug] Ow! Dammit!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight and I are both writing letters to our clients. I'm just sending a quick note to say how much I appreciate their business, and he is writing notarized letters to inform them them that lying on customer reviews is a prosecutable form of fraud and defamation. It's just... different styles.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: My job is to manipulate the customer into buying paper. In return, they give me money. I am the predator and they are the prey. Would a mouse give a positive review to a hawk? Should the hawk even care? [sighs heavily, nearly starts to cry] Excuse me, I've got work to do.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [laughs heartily and passes a newspaper to Phyllis]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [laughing] It's good!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey, what are you laughing at?

quotes.speaker: Stanley and Phyllis
quotes.line: [continue to laugh]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Are you laughing at me?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: We're laughing at this cartoon! [passes newspaper to Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Perfect, isn't it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [looks at cartoon] How is that funny? What are you really laughing at? Huh?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Haven't you been following the news? Ther university is using its non-profit status to fund its private real estate investments.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [laughing louder] And he really nailed them on it. Somebody's finally holding them accountable!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [looking at cartoon] There's no way you're laughing at this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [peering nervously through conference room window] Oh, I don't have anything to say. I'm just hiding from Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [is seen taking apart his phone receiver to check for listening devices]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's good to be paranoid. People need to be more paranoid. Case in point, JFK. If I had been JFK, I would have seen all three gunmen. I would have pulled out my concealed Luger and fired first. Man in book depository, BOOM!  Grassy knoll, BOOM! Fake Jackie, BOOM! [pretends to kiss, then shoot imaginary person to his left]  Then I shoot myself, so I don't change history and create a paradox. BOOM! But right at the last minute, [contorts head sideways] I twist out of the way of the bullet. Nice try, history. Better luck next year.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So, as it turns out, Dwight is right. How bizarre.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [in Jim's ear] I wonder what else Dwight's been right about....

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Major pharmaceuticals do not want you to know that beet juice has medicinal value both as an aphrodisiac and a laxative.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The Scranton Zoning Board has a strong bias against beet farmers. The mayor is in the pocket of Big Lettuce.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Battlestar Galactica isn't a documentary exactly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The book All The President's Men is about a conspiracy, just not the one people think.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jesus had a daughter, and she was the Mona Lisa.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What we have come to know as fake crab meat is in fact real crab meat, and real crab meat is lobster.
